text: San Gorgonio Mountain is the highest peak in Southern California. The elevation is . It is in the San Bernardino Mountains. It is east of the city of San Bernardino and north-northeast of San Gorgonio Pass. It is within the San Gorgonio Wilderness, part of the Sand to Snow National Monument. The mountain is named after the Saint Gorgonius by Spanish missionaries in the early 17th century. Category:Mountains of California Category:Geography of San Bernardino County, California
title: San Gorgonio Mountain
